testo.en:
A-li-ce (FR) lives and works in Berlin. Graduated from École Supérieure de l’image (Poitiers, FR) and EHESS University (Paris, FR), she works as a video artist and a VJ since 2005. She played in many audiovisual festivals (Mapping Festival (CH), Mira Festival (ES), RoBOt Festival (IT), Vision’R (FR), etc.), with solo and collective projects.
Additionally, she works as a video designer for theatre and teaches performative media arts in different institutions and universities. She is also part of Kasseler Dokfest Film Festival curators’ team in the audiovisual live section since 2014, and of Scope Sessions in Berlin.
A part of her artistic research deals with identities and memory questions, which leaded her to collaborate with different Archives Centers, including the creation of the live cinema project Intruders with the german music composer Swub since 2014.
Another part of her work, freely inspired by Alice in Wonderland, is based on colorful psychedelic creatures evolving in magic and absurd landscapes. She started notably in 2010 the mixed-medias work in progress Fucking Wonderland (4 music videos, 1 live video set, 18 drawings), which wasthen exhibited in Kyoto at the national Manga Museum in spring 2014.
Between these two worlds, she uses different techniques, from real video footages to handmade drawings, bringing the audience from wonderful lands to darker realities.
She works at the moment on a new audiovisual piece, Lila, in collaboration with 8 musicians, and as a VJ on the live audiovisual shows of the music composers Robot Koch (DE) and Rag & Bones (FR).

Swub (DE / Berlin) works as a musician and video artist. His videos were shown in exhibitions and video festivals and were awarded with different scholarships and prices [EMAF (DE), goEast (DE), Forum des Images (FR), TENT (NL) etc.].
Currently, he works on his debut album, which will be released in winter 2017.
testo.fr: Swub (DE / Berlin) est compositeur et vidéaste. Son travail a été exposé et récompensé dans différents festivals et lieux d'expositions (EMAF (DE), goEast (DE), Forum des Images (FR), TENT (NL), etc.). Il travaille actuellement à la production de son premier album solo (sortie hiver 2017).

testo.en:
Based on amateur and family film archives from the 1920's to present times, Intruders is an audio-visual memory remix of anonymous stories and portraits, a dancing conversation with our own ghosts. Attracted by nostalgia and voyeurism, we are led into a time travel in which we are increasingly followed by familiar, suspicious and curious glances of unknown human figures, seeking our attention in the present time. Intruding our collective memory, the pictures use their own history to feed our inner emotions and internalised fictions.
Intruders is co-produced by the video art residency Bandits-Mages and the national French archive Centre CICLIC. Inspired by 4000 watched films and 26 hours of collected archive footage, Intruders is an unique contemporary historical document with more than 2000 live sampled and manipulated audio and video sequences. Dealing with collective memory as well as the intimacy and transience of being, the actuality of this audiovisual performance seems to be timeless in today's interconnected media society, which produces permanently archives.


CO-PRODUCED BY:
Bandits-Mages, Bourges (FR) - www.bandits-mages.com
Ciclic, Issoudun (FR) - www.ciclic.fr/patrimoine


SHOWS:
- Studio 43 (Dunkerque, FR), June 2017
- La souris verte (Épinal, FR), April 2017
- B-Seite – Festival für visuelle Kunst und Jetztkultur (Mannheim, DE), March 2017
- Festival Retours vers le futur / Le 9cube (Châteauroux, FR), March 2017
- Lichtspielbühne Weißensee – Open Air Cinema (Berlin, DE), August 2016
- whiteBOX – Everything is a Remix (Munich, DE), July 2016
- Cent Soleils (Orléans, FR), June 16th, 2016
- Les Rencontres Bandits-Mages (Bourges, FR), November 2015 
- Spektrum (Berlin, DE), Oktober 2015

- Festival Les Futurs de l'écrit (Noirlac, FR), May 2015
- Scope Sessions: Transmediale Vorspiel – AV Exposure (Berlin, DE), January 2015
- Festival du Film de Vendôme (Vendôme, FR), December 2014


SUBTITLES
The performance is not based on language. Just a short part includes French audio samples, which will be subtitled in English


TRAILER
http://www.vimeo.com/alicevj/intruders
testo.fr:
Basée sur des films de famille des années 1920 à aujourd'hui, Intruders est une expérience audiovisuelle qui remixe près d'un siècle d'archives filmiques amateurs, à travers la mise en relation de portraits et de scènes de vie anonymes. Alors que la caméra filme et observe sans relâche ces visages, nous sommes peu à peu hantés par leurs regards, étrangement familiers, qui cherchent à attirer notre attention.
Entre nostalgie, vie privée et voyeurisme, que nous donnent à voir ces images aujourd'hui ?
Intruders est une conversation dansée avec nos propres fantômes, une proposition de voyage dans
notre mémoire collective, au plus proche de notre intimité.
Intruders est coproduit par Bandits-Mages et le pôle patrimoine de la région Centre CICLIC.
Les artistes ont ainsi visionné 4000 films pour en extraire et sampler 2000 séquences audio et vidéo, afin de créer cette performance audiovisuelle unique qui traite de la mémoire collective et individuelle. 
Dans une société contemporaine connectée qui crée de l'archive en permanence, ces documents privés d'un autre temps se rappellent à notre imaginaire commun, et utilisent leur histoire singulière pour nourrir nos images intérieures et s'immiscer dans nos fictions personnelles.


COPRODUCTION :
Bandits-Mages, Bourges (FR) - www.bandits-mages.com
Ciclic, Issoudun (FR) - www.ciclic.fr/patrimoine


REPRESENTATIONS :
- Studio 43 (Dunkerque, FR), juin 2017
- La souris verte (Épinal, FR), avril 2017
- B-Seite – Festival für visuelle Kunst und Jetztkultur (Mannheim, DE), mars 2017
- Festival Retours vers le futur / Le 9cube (Châteauroux, FR), mars 2017
- Lichtspielbühne Weißensee – Open Air Cinema (Berlin, DE), août 2016
- whiteBOX – Everything is a Remix (Munich, DE), juillet 2016
- Cent Soleils (Orléans, FR), 16 juin 2016
- Les Rencontres Bandits-Mages (Bourges, FR), november 2015 
- Spektrum (Berlin, DE), Oktober 2015
- La Triennale de Vendôme (Vendôme, FR), juillet 2015
- Festival Les Futurs de l'écrit (Noirlac, FR), mai 2015
- Scope Sessions, Transmediale Vorspiel – AV Exposure (Berlin, DE), janvier 2015
- Festival du Film de Vendôme (Vendôme, FR), décembre 2014


SOUS-TITRAGE
Cette performance n'est pas basée sur le langage mais utilise, pour un court moment, des samples audio en français. Pour un public international, possibilité d'intégrer des sous-titres en anglais.


TRAILER
http://www.vimeo.com/alicevj/intruders

2017-05-19.titolo: Muro de Obscuridad / Wall of Darknes

testo.en:
11:11 is a duo formed by David Kontra (Dr. Kontra) and Ricardo Dorantes (Domon).

His music and audiovisual performance is an immersive experience in dense atmospheres and textures wealth exposed via the error, the digital glitch, debris visual, electronic and hypnotic, with emphasis on optical and tactile qualities of the multi projection.
His musical influence comes from fields such as noise, speedcore, idm, musical improvisation, sonic collage and musique concrete.
Explores 11:11 audiovisual performance on stage with multiple interpretations and proposals based on paranormal phenomena, covering a range of demonstrations macropsicoquinesia (directly observable physical phenomena). Touching and interpret issues arises extraordinary exploration, imagination and questioning the ordinary from a trench playful.
testo.es:
11:11 es un duo formado por David Kontra (Dr. Kontra) y Ricardo Dorantes (Domon)

Su música y performance audiovisual es una experiencia inmersiva en atmósferas densas y de riqueza en texturas expuestas a través del error, el glitch digital, los detritos visuales, electrónicos e hipnóticos, con enfásis en las cualidades táctiles y ópticas de la multiproyección. 
Su influencia musical proviene de campos como el noise, speedcore, idm, la improvisación musical, el collage sónico y música concreta. 
11:11 explora la performance audiovisual en el escenario con multiples interpretaciones y propuestas basadas en fenómenos paranormales,
que abarcan una amplitud de manifestaciones en macropsicoquinesia (fenómenos físicos observables directamente). Al tocar e interpretar temas
extraordinarios se plantea la exploración, la imaginación y el cuestionamiento a lo ordinario desde una trinchera lúdica.

testo.en:
Wall of Darkness is a term in astronomy used to define "deep space", and is also a piece of mathematical fiction by Arthur C. Clarke, where geometric symbolism and singularity are described and interact In impossible universes. David Kontra and Ricardo Dorantes present an audio-visual action based on the sound representation of astrophysics and geometry fiction, dissected and interpreted in live images and videos of aerospace photography, spectrographs, motors, laser guides, robots and space optics.

Link proyecto
clip 01 https://vimeo.com/146330574
clip 02 https://vimeo.com/148701627

Exhibiciones
• Escuela Nacional de Música UNAM / 5to Encuentro Internacional de Arte Sonoro y Audioviusual
• Auditorio Justo Sierra UNAM / Mutante Fest
• AntZen Iszoloscope / Bar GatoCalavera

Spookymental (Visual Artist) is a NRW based creative Artist. His artworks range from small-scale, wall-based pieces to large-scale sculptural installations for cultural institutions and public spaces.

His lines of enquiry include the tension between real and synthesised experiences - the questioning of our relationship with technology, and the creation of a dance performance that transcend the purely physical.
His farthest place of action as a Visual Artist was Afghanistan in 2012. Actual he is a Participant Artist of Fête de l'Anim in Lille.

I’m a Prague based visual performer and video editor involved in video mapping, visual installations, stage and content creation – experimenting new ways to project images on different surfaces, always looking for new forms of narration through interactive media.
Co-founder of the KinocirKus platform, I'm also involved in the organization of the Prague BYOBs and I run regular VJ meetings through the community VJs in Prague.
mesmerizing video mapping made in KinocirKus with live generated visuals. A hypnotic experience following the architectural lines that are not on the object but on my mind.

VJ Juladi creates new pictures and makes sounds visible.

Before every projection begins the search for out of the ordinary pictures, a unexplored perspective, a hidden treasure. With every performance, the video artist gets into the atmosphere, the visual lights, music and audience with her mix of local pictures, movements, artistic talent... as well as available optical snippets.

The senses are invited to journey through the beautiful composition of picture and sound.

VJ Juladi studied at the Stuttgart Media University. The media design and electroacoustics composition courses at the Bauhaus University in Weimar developed her feeling for music and pictures. In 2004, she broadcasted a weekly live programme with two friends which was devoted to psytrance and which was broadcasted in the Stuttgart area through UKW and worldwide over the internet.

VJ Juladi is Elke from Nuertingen near Stuttgart (Germany), who likes to present pictures, but also doesn't want to show too much. A good example are the clouds in the sky. Everyone discovers something different and every observer has their own imagination of the pictures.

Juladi - handmade - performance is a live-dance-video-performance which invites the eyes to think... how are the pictures created? How is the movement recorded and what´s real and what fiction? Which feedbacks, colours and unsharp pictures wants the artist and which are just gonna happen because of the bugs of the technique? A game with the projection screen for the projection screen... which movement creates which pictures? Each performance is different and each time it´s exciting again...

Paulina Ptaszyńska born in Ząbkowice Śląskie in Poland.
Graduated from the Institute of Fine Arts at Opole University. She got Master degree in the Faculty of Graphic Design and New Media in 2011. Currently she works at the Institute of Art at the University of Opole. Her work experience is based on new media, multimedia installation, mapping, graphic design and photography.
testo.pl:
Paulina Ptaszyńska ur. 1986 r. w Ząbkowicach Śląskich.
Ukończyła studia w Instytucie Sztuki Uniwersytetu Opolskiego. W 2011 roku obroniła dyplom z zakresu Nowych Mediów. Obecnie pracuje w Instytucie Sztuki Uniwersytetu Opolskiego. Zajmuje się działaniami z zakresu nowych mediów, instalacją multimedialną, mappingiem, projektowaniem graficznym oraz fotografią.

testo.en: Observing, analyzing, and transforming the processes of nature has become the starting point for reflections on cause and effect, creative act and human perception. Spectrum on the one hand focuses on the reduction of the image, on the other hand on its suggestiveness. At the starting point there is light, which is the beginning of everything, allowing us to perceive the colors available to our perception.
testo.pl: Obserwowanie, analizowanie i przekształcanie procesów natury stało się punktem wyjścia do rozważań na temat przyczyny i skutku, aktu twórczego i ludzkiej percepcji. Widmo z jednej strony skupia się na redukcji obrazu z drugiej strony na jego sugestywność. W punkcie wyjścia znajduje się światło, będące początkiem wszystkiego, pozwalające dostrzegać dostępne naszej percepcji kolory.

2017-05-19.titolo: From Lines to Leaves - mapping version

testo.en:
L’Aubaine (Laurie Bender) VJ, visual artist from Geneva based in London.

L’Aubaine started performing live visuals in 2005 while studying a master in Digital Arts in Barcelona. From her study she got interested in real-time performances and exploring different forms of narrative. And since she expresses herself through VJing, AV narrative, mapping and more recently leds installations. 

All elements she uses in her work are self-produced, mixing different techniques, analogue and digital, as hand-drawn animations, illustration, typography, photography, graphical elements and videos. Her creations have that handmade feel, imperfect, bold and very colourful. In her VJ sets, she feels like a painter on his canvas, creating evolving compositions live. She crafted her unique style over the years by superimposing layers, interlinking shapes and colours, mixing elements from different techniques in an unusual and elegant way.

In her AV narrative or Live Cinema projects, she expresses socio/politics/psychological concerns such as immigration, urbanisation and also travelling as a metaphor of an inner quest. She collaborates with producers/musicians for AV projects, live visuals, music videos and graphic design nowadays mainly with Basilar Records.

Since 2015, she is part of VJ London, organising the monthly meet-up & showcase with artists based in the London area and international artists.

Post collision sonogram is an audiovisual performance, in which visual configuration, feeding of the sound improvisation, is shifting the rectilinear initial simplicity to more complex situations that tend to apparent chaos, a dynamic molecular movement, in which unstable the structures are drift to fluctuating paths zigzaging in space following the sound frequencies, to put to flight.
The piece is divided into 3 parts: linear Simplicity, Complexity and dynamics Fluctuations
The visuals were generated with the application GAmuza, analyzing data from four-channel sound. The sound was developed by bass and electric guitar, both processed. Distortion effects and panning bass were generated with Pure Data.

As a VJ, they perform as an AudioVideo Live Act while they are also part of various production teams in electronic music. The main focus of their work lies in the exploitation of software failures, so called glitches, real time processing, live coding, machine learning as well as the direct interaction of sound and image. testo.it:
Eric Medine è un artista di Los Angeles che lavora nell’ambito dell’arte multimediale e della video arte. Recentemente ha completato una residenza al Centro de Can Serrat Artisticas Actividades a Barcellona, in Spagna. Ha tenuto numerose conferenze, workshop e presentazioni su temi quali la curatela nell’ arte elettronica, hacking hardware dei video giochi e programmazione di software per mostre di opere video dal vivo. Attualmente è co-direttore di La-Va.org, una community di video artisti organizzata in maniera informale, che lavorano principalmente nel campo del live video mixing e dell’improvvisazione in performance visual dal vivo. Da ottobre 1999 a ottobre 2004 ha aperto i Drivethru Studios, una galleria non-profit indipendente dedicata agli artisti emergenti che operano nel campo della pittura, video e scultura. Nel giugno 2002 ha curato e ha contribuito ad una mostra con la Faites de la Lumiere Group a Marsiglia, in Francia, e nell'autunno del 2002 si è recato in Bulgaria per curare e mostrare il proprio lavoro all'interno della mostra "Second by Second ", presso la Galleria Lessedra a Sofia, in Bulgaria.
Nel 2004 ha chiuso il Studios Drivethru per trasferirsi a Los Angeles e conseguire una laurea presso la Otis School for Art and Design. Da allora ha esibito i suoi lavori al Los Angeles Juried Exhibition, presso l’ Angels Gate Art Center, la Track 16 Gallery a Santa Monica, il SuperSonic Exhibition al Barnsdall Art Park di Los Angeles, il Walled Cities Gallery a San Pedro, Andrew Shire Gallery a Los Angeles, e al KunstVlaai Exhibition ad Amsterdam.
testo.en:
Eric Medine is a Los Angeles area artist working in multimedia and video art. Most recently he completed a residency at the Can Serrat Centro de Actividades Artisticas in Barcelona, Spain. He has given numerous lectures, workshops, and presentations on topics such as curating electronic art, hacking video game hardware, and software programming for live video exhibitions. He currently is co-director of La-Va.org, a loosely organized communtiy of video artists working primarily in the field of live video mixing and improvised visuals.

From October of 1999 to October 2004 he ran Drivethru Studios, a not-for-profit, independent gallery dedicated to emerging artists working in painting, video, and sculpture. In June 2002 he curated and contributed to an exhibition with the Faites de la Lumiere group in Marseilles, France, and in the fall of 2002 traveled to Bulgaria to curate and show his own work at the "Second by Second" exhibition at the Lessedra Gallery in Sofia, Bulgaria.

In 2004 he closed down the Drivethru Studios and relocated to Los Angeles to pursue a graduate degree at the Otis School for Art and Design. Since then he has shown work at the Los Angeles Juried Exhibition, the Angels Gate Art Center, Track 16 Gallery in Santa Monica, the SuperSonic Exhibition at the Barnsdall Art Park in Los Angeles, Walled Cities Gallery in San Pedro, Andrew Shire Gallery in Los Angeles, and the KunstVlaai Exhibition in Amsterdam.

Steffen Koch is a multitalent. He is the owner of a filmmaking company, producing music, programming video plugins, ...

He is also co-founder of the german VJ-Crew named Queps, which was founded in 1998.

In his work as a video artist, he has performed over 600 shows with various music styles such as techno, dubstep, ska, house, rock, ambient, electro-acoustic composition etc.
From the small club and small projection area with 300 people to large events with LED-WALL as the main artist in front of 50.000 people.
2006 he is the winner of the LUX VJ contest in the large region of Saar Lor Lux.
He has performed with renowned artists such as a prominent German composer Prof. Lothar Voigtländer, DJ Rush, Mark Foggo,
Toc Toc, the Ragga Twins, Northen Lite, Zion Train, ....

Videosequences are projected, changed, superimposed and put into a new context in real time by the live video artist Steffen Koch.
The atmosphere in the room inspires the artist to a spontaneous experimental film. He understands the screen as a source of light and therefore adjusts it
To become active. The spectator or dancer becomes part of his performance by means of an alienated live camera.
The result is an unparalleled, unique overall work of art at the moment of the performance.
Steffen Koch constantly tries to create images that represent a pleasure for the eyes.

JJ Fresh de Brie is a two young artists collective (Julie Freichel and Jeannie Brie). By using real-time video they grows collaborative performances with musicians questioning links between sound and image.

In the style of collage they stick and fix images gleaned from their own library to create new pictures exploiting a two screens projection. They play with the dialogue of both videos with the aim of taking the audience to a new landscape.

Aware of sound/image interaction give rise to new meanings they progress inside the space in between leading the audience to create his own narrative.

« Iamacumia » is the meeting point of JJ fresh de brie's visual experimentations and the CHANMAX sound project.

Iamacumia = 1 DJ + 2 VJs

First step : Gleaning sound // images

Second step : Mixing sound // Creating visual landscapes

Third step : modeling everything

Final : in each audience his own reality

Bridging the divide between dance, jazz, funk, rock and the growing dance music movement, Dialoque is an electro jam bound to sound different and take the live electronic scene by storm. The band is an exchange of melodic phrases that blur the lines between genres, and allow its blend of synthetic, electronic and organic sounds to fill up any room.
With musicians from all sorts of backgrounds and genres, Dialoque has evolved into creating sounds with a strong foundation, in which the band is able to let go from, and capture the essence of a wholly unique, this-is-happening-here-and-now experience.

By creating jams through improvisation, and by embracing serendipity, the band is able to impact their audiences through melodic and emotional progressive sets. In this way, spontaneity is the main element that sparks an interaction between the band and its audience – a rhythmic dialogue between the artist and the public, with catchy melodies and harmonious riffs, is then created. Dialoque’s music is therefore truly about the live set experience, as each performance gives away to an entire different jam – a pleasant surprise for both the listeners as for the band.

The name Dialoque derives form the musical give-and-take in which every instrument is able to surpass the limits of its unique style, exploring musical chances, which come and go and become tangible at the moment.

The band is working together with Lisa Derksen Castillo ( VJ Vish) and created a first cinematic live show at the end of 2015. Since then they hardly can't do without her creative input and energetic presence.

Dialoque releases their complete new series called Gem Sessions. This time they'll bring you their sessions recorded live from their studio.

They kick off the serie with the first Gem called Blue Velvet, a 23 minute magical smooth jam session. Hop on the ride and join them on the their musical journey and experience the deep multiple phases of this ever rising adventure!

VJ Juladi creates new pictures and makes sounds visible.

Before every projection begins the search for out of the ordinary pictures, a unexplored perspective, a hidden treasure. With every performance, the video artist gets into the atmosphere, the visual lights, music and audience with her mix of local pictures, movements, artistic talent... as well as available optical snippets.

The senses are invited to journey through the beautiful composition of picture and sound.

VJ Juladi studied at the Stuttgart Media University. The media design and electroacoustics composition courses at the Bauhaus University in Weimar developed her feeling for music and pictures. In 2004, she broadcasted a weekly live programme with two friends which was devoted to psytrance and which was broadcasted in the Stuttgart area through UKW and worldwide over the internet.

VJ Juladi is Elke from Nuertingen near Stuttgart (Germany), who likes to present pictures, but also doesn't want to show too much. A good example are the clouds in the sky. Everyone discovers something different and every observer has their own imagination of the pictures.

L’Aubaine (Laurie Bender) VJ, visual artist from Geneva based in London.

L’Aubaine started performing live visuals in 2005 while studying a master in Digital Arts in Barcelona. From her study she got interested in real-time performances and exploring different forms of narrative. And since she expresses herself through VJing, AV narrative, mapping and more recently leds installations. 

All elements she uses in her work are self-produced, mixing different techniques, analogue and digital, as hand-drawn animations, illustration, typography, photography, graphical elements and videos. Her creations have that handmade feel, imperfect, bold and very colourful. In her VJ sets, she feels like a painter on his canvas, creating evolving compositions live. She crafted her unique style over the years by superimposing layers, interlinking shapes and colours, mixing elements from different techniques in an unusual and elegant way.

In her AV narrative or Live Cinema projects, she expresses socio/politics/psychological concerns such as immigration, urbanisation and also travelling as a metaphor of an inner quest. She collaborates with producers/musicians for AV projects, live visuals, music videos and graphic design nowadays mainly with Basilar Records.

Since 2015, she is part of VJ London, organising the monthly meet-up & showcase with artists based in the London area and international artists.

L’Aubaine played in several festivals and events in Europe such as, Le Zoo (Geneva), Off Signal (Prague), LPM (Amsterdam, Rome, Eindhoven), Shambala festival (UK), Blissfields festival (UK), Hackney Wicked (London), Knockan Stockan (Ireland), Visual Brasil (Barcelona), Mostra Sonora i Visual (Barcelona), Fundub (Barcelona), Festival Femelek (Barcelona), etc… and some of her videos were also shown in festivals and exhibitions such as Festival Vertical (Spain), Mostra Arte Digital, Caixa Forum (Barcelona), Festival Internacional de la Imagen (Colombia).

My style
My Veejay style is Ethno-Structural. Real videos of a person are switched up with fast-motion scenes of freeways and large crowds of people together with colorful structures. References to indigenous peoples and life itself in all its facets are depicted again and again. 

In part, retrospective elements are switched up with camera angles of daily life.

References
Within the past 13 years, I have performed at more than 600 events. The spectrum of my performances has ranged between openings of various artists, to trade fairs, to live video performances with various bands, all the way up to dance events of the techno, minimal, drum and bass, reggae, dub, rock, and punk music genres, as well as many others.

Exploring dimensions far beyond just our own, Trippin Jaguar’s definition of reality is constantly called into question. Musical dreams and psychedelic themes, they are his to conjure, connected through waves of energy and narrative and most importantly: free of earthly boundaries as tempo, time and strict cadences. Instead, the Jaguar explores dualities: biological and technological, spiritual and scientific, modern and ancient. Translating stories from behind the facade of words and sentences into auditory anecdotes, built of cosmic synths, contemporary beats and kaleidoscopic sounds. For those who are willing, this cat will invoke visions of a trip across different musical planes into the furthest antipodes of the mind: from the highest mountains to the deepest jungles.

Irina Sales Grade graduated in Architecture at the Faculty of Sciences and Technology of the University of Coimbra (2007). She began working in video-jamming in 2006, and in 2007 she created the project Receyecler, dedicated to the production of image and video content for cultural events. Receyecler’s imagery wavers between architecture and video art, and establishes a communication interface with music. The project addresses video at once as a creative object, an element in sound creation, and an abstract object to be handled in real time. Receyecler thus “recycles” video sequences from a wide range of sources, recalling past works and artists. Receyecler therefore intends to address the most diverse areas of practice.

"landing disconnections" is an experimental live act project in which film footage are mixed and remastered in real time, exploring the boundaries between what is real and what is “impossible”, asking the viewer to define his or her own compromise between belief and disbelief, music and the dichotomy between the beauty found in the finished art object and the creative process nightmare
"landing disconnections" gathers more than 1200 footage clips, mostly film shots, and the narrative is built, synchronized and edited live according to the music development. In each show nearly 500 to 600 footage clips are used to tell a story in real time. The project can be understood in the context of a real-time, interactive, non-linear narrative in which there is no prior coordination between DJ and VJ.

"landing disconnections" is an immersive, intimate experience connecting music, video, image and viewer.

Kesson Dalef (Giovanni Muzio, 1988) is an artist and researcher, graduated in New Media Art, whose work is focused on the concept of growth, and the belief of readiness in embracing the inevitable changes. This informs the idea that human growth and individual growth can only happen through other individuals and that intelligence exists wherever there is humanity.

His past experiences include working in the mediaintegrati group, such as, Festival del Bacio, #cuoredinapoli and many individuals exhibitions at Flussi Festival at Avellino city and Evo Festival at Eboli.

His aesthetic is synthetic and minimalistic and it’s formed by few stylized colors, simple shapes, dots and lines connected in polymorphic rhizomes, geometry, research carried out in the field of aesthetics on the poetic beauty of mathematics and trigonometry, hallucinations experienced hic et nunc, lines of light ranged in the non-space of the mind, clusters and constellations of data, all in an unthinkable complexity.

.sync is a live performance that explore new ways to make it synchronised over the network, to make it more engaging for the audience, being something in the middle between live visuals and video installation. It explore synchronicity between artists and audience, to make everyone feeling as being part of something bigger, everyone can be part of the opera and join it just for that moment, without exclusion.

Also the idea is to provide synchronicity between several device to go out of boundaries and explore new ways of live visuals, more like an installation. Everything is synchronised with the sound and real time generated, with an aesthetic made by codes and math, geometry and trigonometry, lines of light.

Please, to have a better idea, have a look at: https://youtu.be/AQL7xeQAZOM

2017-05-20.titolo: VJ set with Antigone at Sfinks700

testo.en: Vj collective based in Warsaw, Poland in presence of Michał Gwardys, Jakub Grzeszczuk and Tomasz Grzeszczuk. We participate in visiual performace stage for almost one year and we specialize in techno music events. Our style is based on assembling oldshool movie clips with simple geometry effects.
Vj performance created at Sfinks700 (Sopot in Poland). Especialy for this event we created set which was inspired by mithology of ancien May culture.

Started in 1985 making music with synths. Next years I was submerged in my Architecture studies, and working freelance as a TV Set Designer, Art direction for Movies and doing International Architectural Ideas Competitions and publishing my work in Japan, Spain, USA and South America.

20 years after this, all this activities melted in one, visuals form my architectural formation, plus music via computers and midi and visual devices

Now a day I'm currently working in four different projects, which al have in common the digital media an electronic sources as a complementary source.

Viajeros Frecuentes : an update of Southamercian permaculture.
Casa Tomada : Buenos Aires trip hopping via soundtrack sampling.
Marte, 4 am : Ambient pop, universal poetry.
Disientegration : my own Audio Visual project, generative visuals ans its live re-processing.
testo.es:
Comencé a hacer música con sintetizadores en 1985, pero los años sucesivos me encontraron dividido entre el arte e inmerso en el estudio y desarrollo de mi carrera de Arquitecto, realizando obras y participando en concursos nacionales e internacionales, realizando set escenográficos para tv, dirección de arte de cine publicitario y publicando mi trabajo en España, Japón y Estados Unidos.
​
20 años después, en 2005, retomo la vía de la música enlazando aquellos sintetizadores del inicio con computadoras, controladores midi y dispositivos visuales
​
Actualmente trabajo en 4 proyectos musicales cuyas aristas son diametralmente opuestas pero todas atravesadas por una búsqueda en la sonoridad electrónica contemporánea y experimental a través del uso de máquinas, medios digitales y computadoras :

Viajeros Frecuentes, resonorización del imaginario Latinoamericano.
Casa Tomada, trip hop porteño mediante soundtrack sampling.
Hay vida en Marte, ambient pop, melodías contemporáneas, y
Biutiful Data, siendo este último mi propio proyecto Audiovisual en el cual los sonidos generan imágenes en vivo y se procesan en tiempo real tornándose reactivas al sonido original.
​
He sido asistente anual a los Workshops Loop de música electrónica que se realizan en Berlin organizado por la firma de software Ableton y he sido orador en su University Tour en la UNSAM.

People who vanishes and got missed.

making an poetical recall to their embodiment.
Music acts as a physical rythmical and ephemeral dimension, and

The Telenoika Collective is an association of free culture and audiovisual experimentation that has developed research in the field of video mapping. In recent years, the group has made a lot of mapping projects in many international audiovisual festivals.

testo.en:
Four days to learn everything related to Video Mapping techniques, from the project idea to the final realization.

Technical study, optical, video projectors, lux, blueprint, 2d, 3d, music and sound effects

Taught by VJ Eletroiman, member of the Telenoika Community.

After a painstaking measurement process, we construct detailed 2D and 3D models of the target surface. We then generate the audio and video content, using these models to “map” the content onto the ﬁnest details of the speciﬁc site. This allows us to visually alter the appearance of the architecture – by controlling light, colour and surface volume – to change its very nature and transform the way it's perceived.

Our standard plan can be sketched as follows:

1. Technical Site Visit for photography and measurements
2. Assessment of site-speciﬁc technical requirements to devise the technical rider
3. Software development
4. 2D and 3D modelling

Azael Ferrer is a multimedia artist from Málaga, Spain who is based in San Francisco and practicing in the Bay Area + beyond since 2012. His work includes A/V installation, Vj, Lighting ,visual & scenic design for live music, theater, dance & performances. With a solid background in theater lighting, 7 years as technical lighting and video to Canovas Theater (Malaga). Azael creates immersive experiences through generative graphics, light, sound and objects at the space. His practice is an experimental and elegant exploration of digital arts, tech, + multi-sensory perception.
 
He learned his craft at Audiovisual Performance in Marbella (Málaga) and honed it through select participation in workshops including Vjspain, Center of Scenic Studies of Andalusia, International University of Andalusia, The Crucible in Oakland, the scholarship at the Gray Area Foundation, creative code in San Francisco, and the scholarship Lights in Alingsas, Sweden.
 
He is presently a studio artist with the SF collaborative-collective, Merchants of Reality and he is Co-founder of La Caverna de amores, Malaga, Spain. His personal and collaborative projects have been shown across Europe & the United States.

LED technology in the performances arts. The technique ''Pixel Mapping'' is the use of software to map and replay media such as bitmaps or video on an array of lighting fixtures. The fixtures could be anything; moving spots, PAR cans, etc, but the use of colour mixing LED (inc Pixeline, Versa Tube or RGB LED) is a common and appealing technique. 

The workshop on Pixel MAPPING aims to transmit the knowledge necessary to approach to use these techniques for audiovisual installation, performances or any kind of event. 

Content:

1- Presentation.
2- Pixel Mapping. 
3- The Lighting.
4- The LED. A revolutionary.
5- Light Fixtures.
6- Power & Dimmers
7- Communication protocols.
8- Pixel Mapping Softwares and lighting consoles
9- Madmapper
10- Practices

2017-05-20.titolo: Interactive Interfaces | vvvv for advanced interactivity art [80 €]

testo.it: Il ToolKit Festival nasce con la volontà di creare un appuntamento internazionale per gli artisti emergenti che si muovono nel campo dell’arte interattiva. L’idea nasce da un’artista che al suo progetto avvicina un gruppo di persone motivate dagli stessi interessi per realizzare il Festival. Insieme si sono posti le questioni sullo statuto dell’arte interattiva e sugli spazi espositivi disponibili per gli artisti che afferiscono alle discipline della New Media Art.

testo.en:
The intensive workshop provides knowledge and abilities to create interactive interfaces using Vvvv software and different devices: Kinect, Neurosky and Smartphone.

During the workshop the attendees will produce graphic layouts on which will be possible to interact through hand's movement, facial expressions, control of the thought and display touch.

The workshop’s aim is to learn to manage the display of an innovative presentation, that can be employed in professional and working environment.

PLEASE NOTE:
It requires no specific knowledge: the course starts teaching the basics of Vvvv software (vvvv.org) and interactive environment with reference to contemporary art. The participants must have their own laptop (installation instructions vvvv.org/downloads | 32bit version + addons). 
Install also: VLC (videolan.org/vlc). 
Optional: a three-button mouse.

Elwira Wojtunik e Popesz Csaba lang è un duetto polacco-ungherese di artisti visivi fondato nel 2004. Progettano video live-acts unici sulla base di esperimenti dal vivo con video, proiezioni di grande formato, mapping, performance audiovisive, video-installazioni interattive o proiezioni video per spettacoli teatrali. 

Hanno partecipato come Artist-in-Residence al programma del MuseumQuartier a Vienna completato con una mostra presso la Electric Avenue (MQ). Le loro opere sono state esposte anche al Media Art Biennale WRO, Akarenga Soko Gallery di Yokohama in Giappone, Salon-Projektionist a Vienna. Il loro video sperimentale 'NZ / X' è stato premiato nei fotogrammi del Chopin Year competition del Warsaw Electronic Festival e la Zachęta Gallery of Art in Polonia e al ArtMuse a Bocholt, Germania. 

Fondatori di Share: Cracovia - l'unità di organizzazione globale dedicato al sostegno e alla collaborazione e lo scambio di conoscenze nelle comunità di nuovi media.
testo.en:
Elwira Wojtunik and Popesz Csaba Láng is a Polish-Hungarian duet of visual artists founded in 2004. They design unique visual live-acts based on live experiments with the video surface, wide-format projections, mappings, audiovisual performances, interactive video-installations or video projections for theatre shows. 

They were granted with Artist-in-Residence program of MuseumQuartier in Vienna completed with an exhibition at the Electric Avenue (MQ). Their works were exposed also at the Media Art Biennale WRO, Akarenga Soko Gallery in Yokohama in Japan, Salon-Projektionist in Vienna. Their experimental video ‘NZ/X’ was awarded in the frames of the Chopin Year competitionby Warsaw Electronic Festival and Zachęta nationally Gallery of Art in Poland and ArtMuse in Bocholt, Germany.

Founders of Share:Krakow - the unit of global organization edicated to supporting collaboration and knowledge exchange in new media communities.
testo.pl:
Elwira Wojtunik i Popesz Csaba Láng :: polsko-węgierski duet artystów wizualnych znany jako Elektro Moon Vision, który powstał w Budapeszcie w 2004 roku. Obecnie mieszkają w Krakowie. W ich portfolio znajdują się projekty multimedialne związane z nurtem szeroko pojętego video-artu realizowane w formie widowisk wizualnych, performance’u audiowizualnego, interaktywnych instalacji wideo, wielkoformatowych projekcji multimedialnych, w tym mappingu przestrzennego czy projekcji wideo w spektaklach teatralnych (Teatr Stary w Krakowie). W swoim działaniu podejmują najczęściej temat miasta, technologii i człowieka jako jednostki, korzystając z własnych programów i konfiguracji technologicznych.
Ich prace prezentowane były m.in. w galerii Salon Projektionist i MuseumsQuartier w Wiedniu, w galerii Akarenga Soko w Yokohama, w Japonii. Praca audiowizualna NZ/X została nagrodzona w konkursie Choping Narodowej Galerii Sztuki Zachęta i WEF oraz podczas festiwalu ArtMuse w Bocholt, w Niemczech. Zapraszani są na międzynarodowe festiwale prezentujące nowe sztuki wizualne takie jak ArtMuse, sound:frame w Wiedniu, Cinema Total w Berlinie czy VJ Fest w Stambule, a w Polsce gościli m.in. na festiwalu sztuki digitalnej Digital_ia, FreeForm Festival, Selector czy Narracje::Instalacje i interwencje w przestrzeni publicznej w Gdańsku.

Są stypendystami programu Artist-in-Residence w MuseumsQuartier w Wiedniu. Założyciele i organizatorzy Share:Krakow, otwartej platformy zrzeszającej artystów nowych mediów.

Federico Corradi, PhD, is a Research and Development Scientists at IniLabs GmbH, his research focuses at the interface between neuroscience and neuromorphic engineering.

Federico is interested in answering basic research questions that are related to the way biological neural circuits carry out computation, and at the same time in developing a new generation of computing technologies based mixed signal analog/digital CMOS VLSI devices. 

Federico contributions to the field include novel microelectronic bio-inspired processors and methods for implementing spike-based computation.

A beginners introduction to live coding environments for music production: TidalCycles (tidalcycles.org) and SuperCollider (supercollider.github.io).

1. Brief history of generative music and its aesthetical relations with live coding and others performing practices releated to software programming. Meanwhile, will be place an assisted installation of required open-source environments (TidalCycle for Atom and Supercollider IDE).

2. Introduction to Sound Synthesis basic concepts using SuperCollider codes examples, with a strong focus on sample based techniques like Granular Synthesis.

3. Introduction to Algorithmic Composition basic concepts using Live Coding configurations based on SuperCollider: SC+JITLibrary and SC+TidalCycle.

4. Introduction to OSC basic concepts, and example of network performance configuration (more laptop playing over network sendig messages to a single audio server).

Note: suitable for anyone with a laptop, is not required any programming skill of any kind.

Lunchmeat is an audiovisual creative studio as well as an organizer of various public audiovisual events. A core of our work lies in symbiosis of visuals and music. We are always trying to use the projections and sound in an original way. Lunchmeat is based in Prague and is cooperating with talented artists, producers and collectives both in Czech Republic and abroad. Our field of activity goes from the scenogprahy and 3D visualisation, through design, typogrhaphy and graphics work, video art, vjing, street video performances, or event and festival production. In five years of it's existence, Lunchmeat prepared five annual festival with an international lineup and audience. For a year now we are also running Neone club, venue for progressive electronic music and projections, hosting artists and producers from all over the world. Frequently we are working with the projections and light instalations in the public space (in form of site-specific pefrormance we call "the process" - so the audience can observe the whole process of preparation and execution of the audiovisual piece). We also like to share our experience through workshops and public lectures. Every year we are bringing an interesting abroad artist or studio for two weeks creative art residency. The residents creates annualy an original stage design for the Lunchmeat festival including unique visual set for the headliner of the festival.

Working with lunchmeat crew since 2012 to develop and communicate our ideas and aesthetic
in charge of production and cooperation

Lunchmeat started with public art interventions in 2010. Since than iniciated more than fifteen different art projects in public space. Last years introduced together with Lumitrix company unique way to present outdoor video art projects permanently.

Federico Corradi, PhD, is a Research and Development Scientists at IniLabs GmbH, his research focuses at the interface between neuroscience and neuromorphic engineering.

Federico is interested in answering basic research questions that are related to the way biological neural circuits carry out computation, and at the same time in developing a new generation of computing technologies based mixed signal analog/digital CMOS VLSI devices.

Conventional vision sensors see the world as a series of frames. Successive frames contain enormous amounts of redundant information, wasting memory access, RAM, disk space, energy, computational power and time. In addition, each frame imposes the same exposure time on every pixel, making it difficult to deal with scenes containing very dark and very bright regions.

The Dynamic Vision Sensor (DVS) solves these problems by using patented technology that works like your own retina. Instead of wastefully sending entire images at fixed frame rates, only the local pixel-level changes caused by movement in a scene are transmitted – at the time they occur. The result is a stream of events at microsecond time resolution, equivalent to or better than conventional high-speed vision sensors running at thousands of frames per second. Power, data storage and computational requirements are also drastically reduced, and sensor dynamic range is increased by orders of magnitude due to the local processing.

What is it this future that we talk about? It’s like the destruction of pure rationality, it’s like a process, like a a system that just grows with no logic or with a different logic, like a “fit” logic. Smaller spaceships will fit in different spaces and change the shape for the connection system, everything is adapting and it grows with no big plan, but it plans every small step, in this way it’s not so different from the medieval cities.Private and Public will be almost the same, since everything is in constant movement, vegetation will be a part of the system, as energy and water. We will drastically reduce the need to be outside, commercial streets will disappear…This is not bad, just different. We will produce every object with printers, even clothes, which will completely change our appearance. We will be mainly intellectual beings. If you look at it in a different scale, we will be like cells inside a body, the spaceship will really be like an animal, or at least a living being. The digital and the “real” will be so connected that we will not separate them, it will be our interface of life, it’s not like “The Matrix” where we live with our minds trapped inside of a digital world, it’s more like it will come outside to our world. We are Error-43 a collective that works with technology mainly in an abstract way, by abstract we mean that we produce work that doesn’t have an immediate porpoise other than to imagine and create paths to the future, in order to fulfi l this task we work with the digital and the analog. Our work meditates about our own vision, in between what we believe and what we want to happen, using artistic means to represent it.

How can a black hole change everything, even everything? It is notable the investigation of the human being able to discover that there are points somewhere in our surroundings that bring together a number of inexplicable forces capable of altering our whole environment. This visual audio performance seeks to convey this fact through sound and image, we try to transform our environment in a way that brings us back to these inaccessible forces of the black masses.

Stefan Christov (b.1982) is one of the 101 most influent contemporary artists in Bulgaria (The Bulgarian Nouvelle Vague 2011), best known for his live performances in experimental, idm and ambient music genres. He was studying jazz and classical trumpet and played together on stage with popular bands like Wax Tailor, Mad Professor, De-Phazz.
As a composer he was nominated in 2011 by the Bulgarian Theatre Academy in category Best music for theatre. Since the last 10 years he has composed the music for many contemporary and alternative theatre pieces, movies and art performances, such as Operville by Ivo Dimchev – Best Bulgarian contemporary performance for 2016. Stefan is working and living in Sofia, Bulgaria, from where he creates the deep ambient music for the new NASA UHD TV channel with documentaries from space.

Digilogue is an audiovisual piece for two artists who integrate their bodies in an immersive virtual scenes (a digital mise en abyme) while recounting a story of how to transform duality and how harmony is born from dissonance. All sounds and animations are created in the very moment based on the interrelations between music and visual art and their sensory conjunction. 
Digilogue explores bio-virtual mechanisms for restructuring and generating from the inside out. The main goal of the artistic process is to combine different dissonances – visual, cognitive and music – and to find an overall basic concept between them. Digilogue is also a deep journey through the inner human space in the context of the postdigital age.
Digilogue includes computational methods for visualizing and music processing and a sensor based live performing. High frequency flickering should be taken seriously in consideration.
Music, sounds and voice – Stefan Christov
Visual environment and voice – Anna Bacheva

Cyberdelic Reality 1.0 is the first in a new series of Audiovisual Performances by Q p.o.p.
--- 1.0 - A quantum reality representing a remixed planet Earth ---
Live audiovisual cinematic performance, combining Cyber punk references and psychedelic visuals. The soundscape combines Psychedelic sounds and Noise to create rhythmic pulses, sounds that have traveled from the Earth and speak through the technology by electrical currents. The main concept of the performance is about where Technology meets the bio-rhythmic pulse within the subconscious, a cerebral experience which uses remixed elements from pop culture and presents a vision of a future which may already be here. As with much of the previous work done as Q p.o.p. the main overarching concept is based on using tools to make adjustments to our reality, Questioning the information we receive through the Mass Media of the modern age and combined with the notion of quantum realities.
Production, arrangement and performance by marQu vr.

Joana Chicau [jobcb.github.io/author] is a media designer, with a background in performance - classical and contemporary dance. In her practice she investigates the possible connections between – and coexistence of – choreography and media design, aiming to open the possibilities for new aesthetic, energetic and social dimensions in design production processes.

“A WebPage in Three Acts” is an assemblage of visual and graphic experiments into a new hybrid form of composition, combining principles of choreography within the formal structures of coding. The screen becomes an open stage for the new code which links choreography and web programming; body and language.

Dust is an audiovisual performance by Daan Kars. In collaboration with Trevor Reekers and Frank Los , the team creates an harmonic floating audio visual piece disrupted by glitches and bytes.
As the wind passes, pieces off oneself get lifted and are floating in the wind. As physical atoms connect to the stars, we are made of stardust. Morphing and transforming we go through space and time.

This work was born when I ran into an editorial of the semiotic review of books, “Noise Music” by Paul Hegarty (Hegarty 2006), in which are explained all the theorizations on the nature of noise, and i was really wondered by three of those, in which i found the perfect synthesis of my feelings about music, and my relationship with musical composition: the failure to find meaning that i wish to transmit, and the need to find a pure expression and be in communion with people.

Noise as Failure
Noise is only ever defined against something else, operating in the absence of meaning, but caught in the paradox of nihilism – that the absence of meaning seems to be some sort of meaning.

Noise as Communion
Noise offering a communion, a new society, however briefly. Such an approach has close connections to writing on what in the 1990s was referred to as rave/club culture. The emphasis here is on the physical taking over from the rational.

Noise as Authenticity
Noise as pure expression (like Jackson Pollock, or Clement Greenberg's Pollock). This would be one response to Adorno, in saying that noise is only possible in reaction to an all-pervasive hyperculture industry.

LINK: https://soundcloud.com/filippoguida/sets/noise-diary

Recently i was involved in several activities connected to live-coding, a performing arts form and a creativity technique centred upon the writing of source code and the use of interactive programming in an improvised way. In this art practise i found an interesting way to propouse my work as AV performance, presented for the first time in a world wide live streaming streaming organized by Algorave Movement (www.algorave.com).

The VJ EletroIMan develops in his audiovisuals narratives the concepts of Corisco, Macunaíma and Oxossi, characters of Brazilian culture and identity. With this objective, Eletro-I-Man works the video with other techniques like photography and drawing. This idea of convergence allows a dialogue between various techniques, composing a hybrid language that is being developed from the beginning of 2003.

Its activity is related to the development and discussion of audiovisual language of VJs (life cinema) he it is the organizer of the Festival Visual Brasil, http://proyectohibrido.org [http://www.festivalvisualbrasil.com/">http://www.festivalvisualbrasil.com and Hybrid Project
testo.es:
El VJ EletroIMan representa Corisco, Oxossi y Macunaíma, personajes de la cultura brasileña que nos remete a una herencia de resistencia política y a una búsqueda constante de una identidad brasileña.

En su proyecto, Eletro-I-Man tiene como objetivo repensar el vídeo a partir de su conjugación con otras técnicas. Esta idea de convergencia permite un diálogo entre varias técnicas, componiendo un lenguaje híbrido que está se desarrollando desde el principio de 2003.

Su actividad está relacionada con el desarrollo y la reflexión del lenguaje audiovisual de los VJs (life cinema). En este sentido es el organizador del Festival Visual Brasil, http://proyectohibrido.org [http://www.festivalvisualbrasil.com/">http://www.festivalvisualbrasil.com y del Proyecto Hibridos

testo.en:
Representa Corisco Project

The Representa Corisco is audiovideo performance created in 2003, the project works with concepts of the popular culture, icons related to the visual universe of “cangaço” and one of its characters: Corisco. The cangaço was an armed movement that lasted more than two centuries (XIX and XX) in northeaster of Brazil and can be associated with concepts like resistance and fight against the system of hereditary privileges present in the Brazilian history.
testo.es:
El Proyecto nace en 2003 y en estos años hemos desarrollado propuestas desde performances de video a intervenciones urbanas en ciudades como Belo Horizonte, San Paulo y Barcelona. Con el objetivo de proponer reflexiones cri­ticas sobre las relaciones politicas y sociales en las grandes metropolis, el colectivo trabaja con conceptos relacionados con la cultura popular brasilena e iconos visuales que remiten al universo del cangaço y a un de sus personajes: Corisco.

Cangaço fue un movimiento armado que dura mas de 2 siglos (XVIV y XX) en el nordeste brasileno y nos remete a conceptos como de resistencia y cri­tica a los valores impuestos por la elite brasilena. En este sentido, evocar a Corisco y a todos los cangaceros es rescatar el pasado, rescatar todo su universo complejo de lucha, sobrevivencia y poesi­a de desiertos tropicales, en un intento de desarrollar una actuacion poli­tica critica dentro del contexto urbano contemporaneo.

testo.it:
Musicista, produttore, sound designer. Comincia la sua carriera nel 2003 come chitarrista, nel 2007 inizia a sperimentare mescolando elettronica e sonorità acustiche.
Co-fondatore dell'etichetta Yalla Records, lavora come produttore a diversi album ed EP e scrive colonne sonore per video e installazioni.
Nel 2011 lavora alla produzione di svariati remix per alcune etichette americane, fra cui la neo-nata Beat Canteen, grazie alle quali si concretizza nel 2012 il suo primo tour USA, che porterà Sarc:o a esibirsi in diverse venues della west coast.
Nel 2013 vince il prestigioso Golden A'Design Award con il brano "Chasing Space", colonna sonora dell'omonimo video di Marco Bagni; e a seguire pubblica la sua prima raccolta ufficiale di colonne sonore dal titolo "Soundtracks Vol.1", seguita dall'EP "Something Happened" con la collaborazione del duo torinese Yellows. 
Numerose le partecipazioni a eventi e festival dedicati alle arti performative, fra cui LPM e RoBOt, oltre che serate in club e locali.
Nel 2014 produce il disco "Evoluzioni" per l'artista [FRAGMENTS], e “Downtime” per Torafugu.
Nel 2015 esce l’EP “Manifesto”, prodotto da Andrea Suriani (My Awesome Mixtape, i Cani, ecc.), all’ Alpha Dept. Studio, che segna una svolta nelle produzioni di Sarc:o e avvia un nuovo percorso artistico.
www.iamsarco.com
testo.en:
Italy based musician, producer and sound designer. His career started in 2003 as guitarist, and in 2007 he begins experimenting mixing electronic and acoustic soundscapes. 
Co-founder of Yalla Records label, he’s been working as a producer on many records and composed soundtracks for videos and installations.
In 2012 his first USA tour after the release of many remixes for american labels such as Beat Canteen.
In 2013 Sarc:o has been awarded with the Golden A’Design Award for best music and sound design with the production of Chasing Space, soundtrack of the video by Marco Bagni (Lostconversation), and contained in the album “Soundtracks Vol.1” released in 2013. In the same year was released the EP “Something Happened” and started working on the production of two new full lenght albums: “Evoluzioni” for [FRAGMENTS] and “Downtime” for Torafugu, both released in 2014.
In 2015 Sarc:o released the EP “Manifesto”, a break-through in Sarc:o’s music.

// Live Visuals by Takehiko //
Audio/Video performance based on interaction between waveforms and 3D elements.
A live electronic music small concert with acoustics and sampled instrument + a motion graphics 3D animated video narration.
The concept comes from the study of metaphysics and time-space in Luca Pozzi's art, the artist who inspired the video creations.

From the artist's statement:
"The space-time is an all-encompassing container, where everything is next to each other in a holistic sense. There is a strange feeling of frozen time. Past, present and future are indistinguishable. A series of multidisciplinary correspondences are converging into a beautiful network of pure and basic information beyond geographical, political and linguistic borders. The importance of the less intuitive aspects of our reality: quantum gravity, teleportation, entanglement, augmented reality, time travel, cosmology and biodiversity. The result of an unusual correlation between theoretical physics, informatics and contemporary art."

testo.it:
Performance collettiva, una big band che suona dal vivo un musical fatto ad a/v set. con video e suoni provenienti dal mondo animale e naturale, sia quello reale che quello della fantasia, un mix di animazioni e voci sintetizzate, animali fantastici e leggendari, paesaggi da sogno e da incubo, spezzoni di film storici e dimenticati uniti a novità realizzate per l'occasione.

Ogni componente del gruppo suona come in una orchestra a formare una storia comune in cui si succedono le cose più disparate, senza necessariamente un filo troppo logico ne le regole della fabula classica, ma solo per fornire una nuova ed esaltante esperienza.
testo.en:
Collective performance, a live big band playing a musical made in an A/V set, with video and sounds coming from the animals and nature world, from both real and fantasy worlds, a mix of animation and synth voices, fantastic animals and legendary landscapes of dream and nightmare, and forgotten historical film clips combined with new footages released for this occasion.

Each member of the group play like in an orchestra to make a common story in which there are many different things, not necessarily following the rules of the classic fables, but only to provide a new and exciting experience.

The owners of a record player will easily relate to the concept of the Festival for Visual Arts and Contemporary Culture: sometimes it’s the unimposing “B” that is hiding the true gem of a vinyl record. B-Side is tracing these jewels that are prospering out of the limelight. The “B-Seite” festival risks a second look and does not refrain from placing the needle on the grooves that have gone unnoticed.


This non-commercial festival deals with all varieties of modern visual arts, explores media intersections and opens up new perspectives, a different way to look at new trends and developments. Video art, computer art, interactive projection and light design are the cornerstones of this event, discussions, lectures and workshops will complete the offering.

In 2013, the B-Seite festival is celebrating the 6th edition. Featuring the 5th vj conderence in South Germany, great international guests und the common mix of performances, exhibition, parties and workshops.

The B-Seite festival is made in thankful collaboration with the cultural office of the City of Mannheim as well as the FilmCommision Metropolregion Rhein-Neckar and is aided by the City of Mannheim.

Medusa Lab is a multimedia art studio based in Mexico city that specializes in transforming ideas into powerful audiovisual shows. The Lab was founded in 2013 by Ary Ehrenberg, Carlos Xi, Eduardo Olmedo, Moises Regla and Roberto Montiel, who joined forces to create a team of award winning visual artists, internationally recognized for excellence in their work. They are one of the best and most experienced video mapping crews in Mexico.

Neocortex project is a team of young professionals in 3D animation and motion graphics field. Our primary skill is certainly the creation of video mapping performances and visual installations. Our passion is the close connection that exists between audio and video. Currently, we have focused our production on the realization of 3d mapping. This technique allows to give new life and new forms to architectural surfaces or not. Every new project is a challenge for us cause we are constantly searching new expressive forms and techniques that can move away from what has already been done. We are moving forward so…stay tuned!

http://www.neocortexproject.com/

testo.it:
###b###LPM | Live Performers Meeting###/b###

Nato nel 2004, col proposito di rispondere all'esigenza di creare un ambito spazio-temporale di riferimento nel quale fosse possibile incontrarsi, conoscersi e condividere le esperienze legate al vjing, LPM è oggi un ###b###meeting internazionale ###/b###per artisti, esperti ed appassionati di ###b###veejaying###/b###,###b### visual ###/b###e###b### live ###/b######b###video ###/b######b###performance###/b###.

L'evento è caratterizzato da un ###b###programma ricco###/b### di ###b###performance video###/b### aperte al pubblico, eseguite in combinazione con le più varie forme d’espressione artistica, ed una serie di iniziative particolarmente dedicate agli ospiti del meeting.

###b###L'area "On"###/b###, consente al ###b###vasto pubblico ###/b###di assistere alle diverse applicazioni del ###b###video live###/b###, attraverso le###b### performance###/b### di ###b###artisti###/b### e ###b###gruppi ###/b###provenienti dal ###b###panorama internazionale###/b###, all'insegna di un'unica grande passione per il###b### ###/b###video, la performance e soprattutto il “live”. Da mezzanotte in poi ha inizio il ###b###VJ clash###/b###, in cui i videoartisti si alternano liberamente###b### ###/b###alle ###b###consolle video###/b### messe a disposizione, con ###b###numerosi###/b### ###b###proiettori ###/b###e ###b###monitor###/b###.

###b###L'area "Off",###/b### destinata al Meeting, occasione di###b### ###/b######b###confronto###/b### tra ###b###vj ###/b###e ###b###video artisti###/b### attivi nelle tematiche relative alle Video Live Performance, è concepita come spazio a sé stante, frequentato principalmente dagli ###b###"addetti ai lavori”###/b###, con un programma che alterna ###b###spazi d’incontro###/b### a ###b###workshop ###/b###e###b### showcase###/b### di progetti e prodotti.

LPM è uno ###b###spazio aperto###/b### alla ###b###libertà ###/b###d'###b###espressione###/b###, alla ###b###ricerca###/b### e alla ###b###sperimentazione###/b###; la flessibilità del programma, l'apertura verso nuove adesioni e contributi, la libertà di partecipazione e la possibilità di esibirsi nel corso della serata, ne sono una caratteristica intrinseca.

LPM individua nella ###b###sperimentazione###/b### uno dei capisaldi della propria ideologia; tutti i ###b###fondi recuperati###/b### sono perciò destinati al ###b###reperimento ###/b###delle ###b###tecnologie ###/b###più ###b###ambite ###/b###ed ###b###innovative###/b### a sostegno dell'evento e dell'attività di ricerca in ambito live visual.

L'affinità di ideali e le radici ideologiche comuni, hanno fatto si che LPM sia entrato a far parte dell'###b###AVIT network###/b###, la cui attività è finalizzata alla ###b###valorizzazione###/b### e alla ###b###promozione###/b### della ###b###cultura del veejaying ###/b###attraverso l'organizzazione di eventi a livello mondiale.

LPM è prodotto e organizzato da ###b###Flyer Communication###/b### (www.flyer.it), ###b###Linux Club###/b### (www.linux-club.org), ###b###FLxER.net###/b### (www.flxer.net) e ###b###FLV - Flyer Live Visuals###/b###, grazie alla collaborazione di importanti partner internazionali.
testo.en:
###b###LPM - Live Performers Meeting###/b###

Born in 2004, with the aim to answer to the need for creating a space-temporal referential field where to meet, know each other and share vjing related experiences, LPM is now an ###b###international meeting ###/b###dedicated to artists, professionals and passionates of ###b###veejaying, visual ###/b###and ###b###live video performance.###/b###

The event features a###b### full programme###/b### of ###b### live video performances###/b### open to the public, applied in combination with the most varied forms of artistic expression, and a number of initiatives particularly for guests of the meeting.

The###b### "On" area###/b### allows the audience to attend the different applications in live video through the###b### performances###/b### of ###b###artists###/b### and ###b###groups###/b### from the ###b###international scene###/b###, joined by a single great passion for video, performance and above all “Live”. From midnight onwards beginning the ###b###VJclash###/b###, in which video artists ###b###perform free ###/b###from video ###b###consolle ###/b###made available, with many ###b###projectors ###/b###and###b### monitors.###/b###

The###b### "Off" area###/b###, aimed at the Meeting, is an occasion of###b### confrontation ###/b###between###b### vj ###/b###and###b### video artists ###/b###working in the themes of Live Video Performance and is conceived as a separate area, frequented mainly by ###b###"insiders"###/b### with a program that alternates spaces ###b###meeting, workshops###/b### and###b### showcase ###/b###projects and products.

LPM is a space open to ###b###freedom of expression###/b###, ###b###research###/b### and ###b###experimentation###/b###; the programme flexibility, the openness to new members and contributions, the freedom to participate and the opportunity to perform during the event, are an intrinsic characteristic.

LPM consider the ###b###experimentation ###/b###a cornerstone of its ideology, and all the ###b###recovered funds###/b### are therefore allocated to ###b###finding###/b### the most ###b###desirable ###/b###and ###b###innovative technologies ###/b###to support the event and the research in the live visual field.

The kinship of ideals and the common ideological roots, allowed LPM to become part of ###b###AVIT network###/b###, whose aim is the ###b###enhancement ###/b###and ###b###promotion###/b### of ###b###veejaying culture###/b### by organizing events worldwide

LPM is produced and organized by ###b###Flyer Communication###/b### (www.flyer.it), ###b###Linux Club###/b### (www.linux-club.org), ###b###FLxER.net ###/b###(www.flxer.net) and###b### FLV - Flyer Live Visuals###/b###, thanks to the cooperation of important international partners.

LPM in collaboration with Video Mapping Mexico, Medusa Lab and Neocortex is glad to announce the Live Mapping Contest 2017!!!

The length of the show is 10 minutes per applicant and is required to be performed live with sound design or soft recorded music.

I work as a VJ in Berlin, usually using generative sets I've written with a strong component of organic input. The body and embodied movement plays a special part in my performances and is also the link to what I do during the day: study cognitive science.
A shader based feedback loop drawn into with a hacked touchpad creates morphing and moving landscapes. See an example here: http://felixbinder.net/live-visual-kantine-am-berghain/

Sourya Sen aka Oblique is mostly known for his visuals work in the Indian indie scene. Starting from being selected as one of the five artists for the Visual Lab in Colombo in 2014 by Border Movement and providing visuals at Pettah Interchange under the mentorship of Pfadfinderei, since then he’s gone on to work with and tour with artists like Your Chin, Madboy/Mink, Sickflip, Frame/Frame and has worked on the visuals of festivals like Magnetic Fields, NH7 Weekender and at showcases and conferences like ADE Mumbai 2016, AVAxBFS showcase among others. He was also featured on Krunk Live Sessions on MTV Indies as a visual artist in collaboration with Your Chin and Madboy/Mink.

Being exposed to different kinds of music through these experiences, he has been actively working on producing original audiovisual content and striving towards what he likes to call ‘strange audiovisual things’. The first foray into this side of things came with the release of the audiovisual EP Berlin: Not At War in 2015, realised as part of an artist residency. Since then he’s been working on improving his producing skills and learning about different audio synthesis methods and practises.

He believes that visual artists should think more like musicians, and release original audio visual material and not just be support acts a VJs or visualisers for productions. To achieve this goal, he’s been actively looking at different types of audiovisual production techniques, moving away from traditional tools and techniques and learning about generative techniques and algorithmic compositions. 

To further his skills in producing more ‘strange audiovisual things’, he’s currently pursuing a masters in new media design and production at Media Lab, Helsinki where he’s experimenting with different types of production methods, DIY instruments and human computer interaction.

Audiovisual performance using a home made Lunetta style noise box (using CMOS logic to create audio patterns at the intersection of noise and music) and complementing it with custom generative visuals written in openFrameworks. A lot of square waves, noise, patterns and strobes!

Zoey Vero is a visual and installation artist from San Francisco,with a background of a B.A in Architecture from UC Berkeley. She is now based out of Berlin, where she continues VJing, AV projects, creating custom visuals and projection mapping.
 
Her current creative practice explores structures and systems, chaotic behaviors, glitches, sexuality and gender. Immersive and visual environments have become a platform for her to share artwork and experiment with different concepts in material ranging in motion graphics, video art, photography, to generative and interactive art.
 
Zoey has performed and displayed works internationally in festivals and galleries such as the Mapping Festival (Geneva), Live Performers Meeting(Einhoven), Cascina Martesana (Milan), Yunnan Cultural (China), NGBK Arts (Berlin), Burning Man (Black Rock City), Gray Area Arts Foundation (San Francisco), Soundwave Festival(San Francisco), Codame Festival(San Francisco), and the Chabot Space and Science Center (Oakland).

Zoey Vero is a visual artist from San Francisco, now based out of Berlin. In the live-set BODY NOTIONS, she creates visuals that are constantly transforming shapes of human bodies finding their path into glitch landscapes, full with errors and chaos. A visual challenge using motion graphics, video art and live generative visuals to unite our physical reality with a permanently growing and dissociative digital world.

Rag and Bones consists of the music artists Mathieu Poterie and Capucine Bernades; they collaborate since january 2017 with the VJ and visual artist A-li-ce.
Rag and Bones is a project at the crossroads of numerous music styles, such as electronic, electroacoustic, ambient, as well as techno. 
Their music is simultaneously accurate and sharp, allowing those producers to create like a skilled hand would successfully draw a pencil mark. Their debut album "When Can Your Glory Fade ?", is out since the 26th of February, 2016 and they work now on the premiere of their audiovisual performance.

Rag and Bones invites you to the premiere of their audiovisual performance in collaboration with the live visual artist A-li-ce. Mathieu Poterie (music producer) and Capucine Bernades (singer) perform here a musical immersive and introspective journey based on electronic and electro-acoustic sounds, surrounded by the new live visual project of A-li-ce, made of animated organic drawings.

I make visuals to different events since 2007, moving on a wide range of music genres and kind of venues. Festivals, clubs, outdoor events, theatres, cinemas, boats. From experimental generative mapping to mainstream festival vjing moving on a wide range.

Audiovisual set performed by one of the most wanted vjs of Central Europe. Dark, dusty and geometrical visuals.. 
www.digitalistik.hu

Monsieur Nuage (Mister Cloud) invites us to a highly colored graphic environment where the superimposing of images and
textures takes us to a visual world of excitement.
Monsieur Nuage has been fascinated by images and music for numerous years.
In 2002, he finally discovered the video mix.

Some artists for whom he did his video mixes:
Etienne De Crecy & ALex Gopher, jack de Marseille, Ken Ishi, Felix da Housecat, Paul Kalkbrenner, Zongamin, Deetron,Joey
Beltram, Dave Clarke , Deadmau5, matthew herbert, Justin Harris, Phil Weeks, Gene Farris, Jay Tripwire, joris voorn, Redshape.

Some venues: festival of Dour, Culture Club, H2o club, kiosk. Etik. Pixel festival, Name Festival.
testo.fr:
A travers sa pratique, Monsieur Nuage nous plonge dans son univers: graphique, coloré, décalé. Entre superpositions visuelles, jeux d’effets, de textures, il crée un monde visuel d’excitation.  Fasciné par les images et la musique, il pratique depuis plus de dix ans le mélange vidéo et a collaboré, à ce titre, avec de nombreux artistes.

Il oeuvre au sein du collectif Ad Libitum BSides et multiplient les projets communs. A chacun son univers graphique, musical, ses inspirations.
